did.head: Descriptive Summary
did.repository: Special Collections, University of Virginia Library
did.physdesc: This collection consists of an article, January 14, 1964, from the newspaper Sunderland Echo,Sunderland, England and a copy of The Travellers Pocket Map of South Carolina,1830.

userestrict.head: Use Restrictions
userestrict.p:
See the
University of Virginia Library’s use policy.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: George F. Holmes papers, 1830 and 1964, Accession #11207, Special Collections Dept., University of Virginia Library, Charlottesville, Va.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: These items were given to the University of Virginia Library by Barbara Stoudt, Charlottesville, on October 4, 1995.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Information
scopecontent.p: This collection consists of an article, January 14, 1964, from the newspaper Sunderland Echo, Sunderland, England, about the Holmes family estate "Bainbridge Holme," and a copy of The Travellers Pocket Map of South Carolina, 1830, formerly belonging to George Frederick Holmes (1820-1897), who became the first professor in the School of History and General Literature at the University of Virginia in 1857. Holmes continued to be an active member of the faculty until his death on November 4, 1897.
